Reviewing Linked Change Requests

If you are checking in a file that has one or more linked change requests, you should also review all change requests associated with the file. To accomplish this task, you can use the Show Change Requests button.

Instead of using the Show Change Requests button, however, you may prefer to use process items to review linked change requests. Normally, only one method would be used. The differences between the two methods are:

  • The Show Change Requests method uses the existing link and does not create any additional links. Using process items creates or updates a link from every file to the selected change request as part of the check-in process.

  • With the Show Change Requests method, the ends of the link may be pinned or floating. With process items, the ends of the link are always pinned to specific revisions.

To review linked change requests:

  1. Select File > Check In to display the Check In dialog.

  2. Click the Show Change Requests button, at the bottom of the dialog, to display the change requests linked to this file. The Check In dialog expands to show Change requests linked in this view. No change request appears in the list more than once, even if it is linked to several of the files you are checking in. When a change request is linked to more than one file, the list displays the name of only one of the files.

  3. (Optional) Double-click a change request to review or edit its properties.

  4. (Optional) Select the Mark selected change requests as fixed check box. The application will mark the selected, but unresolved, change requests as Fixed as part of the check-in process.

After a change request has been marked as Fixed:

  • If the Show Change Requests button has been used, the link does not change in any way. If the link’s connection to the change request floats from revision to revision, the link becomes attached to the new revision of the change request. If it is pinned to a revision of that change request, it remains pinned there.

  • If process items have been used, the application creates a link from the process item to the revision of the change request that has the Fixed status.
